Created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-17452

> Called it nonEmptyParentMaybeSteal and changed touch to inUse. I didn't reset it to false to avoid risking uncleaned arrays after use.

I did mentally wonder about this after proposing it (without checking) and figured if that were the case we could easily introduce two flags `used` (or `touched`) and `inUse` - set both on touch and unset only `inUse` when empty.

@smiklosovic I'm not sure why, but with that latest update I'm seeing 50+ pytest errors.  This happens even on a clean branch w/out my changes.

FAILED test/test_cqlsh_output.py::TestCqlshOutput::test_timestamp_output - EOFError: 'until' pattern '\n(\\S+@)?cqlsh(:\\S+)?> ' not found
FAILED test/test_cqlsh_output.py::TestCqlshOutput::test_user_types_output - EOFError: 'until' pattern '\n(\\S+@)?cqlsh(:\\S+)?> ' not found
FAILED test/test_cqlsh_output.py::TestCqlshOutput::test_user_types_with_collections - EOFError: 'until' pattern '\n(\\S+@)?cqlsh(:\\S+)?> ' not found

it seems to no longer find my cqlshrc file:
../bin/cqlsh
Connection error: ('Unable to connect to any servers', {'127.0.0.1:9042': AuthenticationFailed('Remote end requires authentication')})

but the installed cqlsh works fine:
% cqlsh
Connected to Test Cluster at 127.0.0.1:9042

@bschoening would you mind to try this?

https://github.com/instaclustr/cassandra/commit/82cdc0a6e656eb192f4883c762a318e82d7af09e

I am wondering, why does your local node require authentication? It should go without any credentials?

Tests are working just fine here, same tells the pipeline. But I verified there is something strange going on which was resolved by what I just did. I think I need to fix that soonish.
yes, that resolves the issue.  The pytests now run ok.   I suppose you'll need to commit that before I can update the PR here.

I have completed first pass without tests..
I'd say last CI run looks good.

indeed, LGTM, thanks. In this case I don't think we really need upgrade tests or any of the others like compression but I am wondering whether we want to add some of those to the pre-commit workflow. Like those for keyspace directories are not run in Jenkins and every now and then regress as people tend not to run them. I can open a ticket, I was just wondering what you think about this.
any update on this PR?

> I don't think we really need upgrade tests or any of the others like compression but I am wondering whether we want to add some of those to the pre-commit workflow. Like those for keyspace directories are not run in Jenkins and every now and then regress as people tend not to run them. I can open a ticket, I was just wondering what you think about this.

Anything added to CI has the downside of increasing the cost, so I think we should be cautious when adding jobs to the pre-commit workflow. I understand that the once-a-week run of CircleCI done by the build lead should include all suites, so we can detect problems with those jobs. 

As for the particular case of system keyspace directories, I don't know how easy is to figure out that a change can have an impact on those tests. If they are easy to break with apparently unrelated changes then we should probably include them on pre-commit tests.

@thingtwin1 this patch seems based on a version of trunk that is more that one month old, and it's missing the 5 new guardrails that have been added since then.

> @thingtwin1 this patch seems based on a version of trunk that is more that one month old, and it's missing the 5 new guardrails that have been added since then.

sorry about that, let me fix it now!
commented or fixed all feedback.

@thingtwin1 thanks for pulling those changes. I think it might be more practical to rebase on top of trunk with `git rebase trunk` instead of merging from trunk on top of the patch branch. That way the PR would show the proposed changes on top of trunk's commits, without the additional merge commit.

It seems that the removal of the property breaks the dtests [`GuardrailCollectionSizeOnSSTableWriteTest`](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/blob/935bcf1e8732a4138c15205896945c2f02ddb844/test/distributed/org/apache/cassandra/distributed/test/guardrails/GuardrailCollectionSizeOnSSTableWriteTest.java#L57) and [`GuardrailItemsPerCollectionOnSSTableWriteTest`](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/blob/935bcf1e8732a4138c15205896945c2f02ddb844/test/distributed/org/apache/cassandra/distributed/test/guardrails/GuardrailItemsPerCollectionOnSSTableWriteTest.java#L52). Those tests are still mentioning the removed property.
